definition: overt/to make no secret (of one's presence)/grandiose/with great scope

(main) hall/large room for a specific purpose/CL:間|间[jian1]/relationship between cousins etc on the paternal side of a family/of the same clan/classifier for classes, lectures etc/classifier for sets of furniture
and/as well as/and so/but (not)/yet (not)/(indicates causal relation)/(indicates change of state)/(indicates contrast)

sentences.english: But this kind of bond offering gives them an officially sanctioned way around the prohibition.
sentences.chinese: 但是這類債券銷售使它們堂而皇之地繞過了禁令。

sentences.english: The stately began to talk about success of the road, the road of life.
sentences.chinese: 便開始堂而皇之的大談成功之道，人生之道等等。

sentences.english: This is all nobly in the name of the country.
sentences.chinese: 這一切卻堂而皇之都是以國家的名義。

definition: (of a person) honorable/not devious/(of a behavior) fair and aboveboard/without tricks/openly/(of a situation) out in the open
to have no sense of shame
in a way that justifies the use of the term/genuine/proper/in a way that conforms to logic/justifiable/appropriate/perfectly legitimate
in the right and self-confident (idiom); bold and confident with justice on one's side/to have the courage of one's convictions/just and forceful

pinyin: shen2 bu4 zhi1 gui3 bu4 jue2

definition: to parade oneself ostentatiously about town (idiom)
